explanation: humorous; to make someone feel confused and unable to think clearly
sentence: I think my brain's been addled by the heat!
sentence_gap: I think my brain's been ______ by the heat!

explanation: to make something bad such as pain or problems less severe
sentence: The drugs did nothing to alleviate her pain.
sentence_gap: The drugs did nothing to _________ her pain.

explanation: wrong, not suitable, or not as expected
sentence: I could see by the look on their faces that something was amiss.
sentence_gap: I could see by the look on their faces that something was _____.

explanation: the space or room at the top of a building, under the roof, often used for storing things
sentence: I've got boxes of old clothes in the attic.
sentence_gap: I've got boxes of old clothes in the _____.

explanation: a wide road with trees or tall buildings on both sides, or a wide country path or road with trees on both sides
sentence: Michigan Avenue in Chicago is famous for its elegant stores.
sentence_gap: Michigan ______ in Chicago is famous for its elegant stores.

explanation: an attempt to achieve something
sentence: The council has banned cars from the city centre in a bid to reduce pollution.
sentence_gap: The council has banned cars from the city centre in a ___ to reduce pollution.

explanation: literary; the front part of your head between your eyes and your hair
sentence: He wiped the sweat from his brow.
sentence_gap: He wiped the sweat from his ____.

explanation: disapproving; a small group of people who plan secretly to take action, especially political action
sentence: He was assassinated by a cabal of aides within his own regime.
sentence_gap: He was assassinated by a _____ of aides within his own regime.

explanation: to burn and become black or to burn something so that it becomes black
sentence: Grill the peppers until the skin starts to char.
sentence_gap: Grill the peppers until the skin starts to ____.

explanation: (especially of food) of very good quality
sentence: I had the the most expensive dish on the menu - a choice fillet of fish.
sentence_gap: I had the the most expensive dish on the menu - a ______ fillet of fish.

explanation: a very strong feeling of wanting to do something repeatedly that is difficult to control
sentence: I seem to have a constant compulsion to eat.
sentence_gap: I seem to have a constant __________ to eat.

explanation: a large, open part of a public building, especially an airport or a train station
sentence: There's a ticket machine in the main concourse.
sentence_gap: There's a ticket machine in the main _________.

explanation: the period of time when you rest and get better after a serious illness
sentence: You need four to six weeks' convalescence.
sentence_gap: You need four to six weeks' _____________.

explanation: formal; to cause someone to be annoyed or unhappy
sentence: The tone of the letter displeased her.
sentence_gap: The tone of the letter __________ her.

explanation: swollen and large in a way that is not normal, especially because of pressure from inside
sentence: The television showed images of starving children with distended bellies.
sentence_gap: The television showed images of starving children with _________ bellies.

explanation: formal; to put on a piece of clothing
sentence: He donned his finest coat and hat.
sentence_gap: He ______ his finest coat and hat.

explanation: in some societies, an amount of money or property that a woman's parents give to the man she marries
sentence: The dowry was never paid, and the king held himself free of his promise.
sentence_gap: The _____ was never paid, and the king held himself free of his promise.

explanation: unable to speak because of surprise
sentence: The news left her dumbfounded.
sentence_gap: The news left her ___________.

explanation: a short journey either to take a message or to take or collect something
sentence: I'll meet you at six, I've got some errands to run first.
sentence_gap: I'll meet you at six, I've got some _______ to run first.

explanation: formal; to remove a dead body from the ground after it has been buried
sentence: The body was exhumed on the order of the judge.
sentence_gap: The body was _______ on the order of the judge.

explanation: the feeling of fear, especially if felt suddenly, or an experience of fear that happens suddenly
sentence: You gave her such a fright turning the lights out like that.
sentence_gap: You gave her such a ______ turning the lights out like that.

explanation: a long, narrow cut in the ground, especially one made by a plow for planting seeds in; a deep line in the skin of the face
sentence: Years of anxiety have lined her brow with deep furrows.
sentence_gap: Years of anxiety have lined her brow with deep _______.

explanation: an extremely strong wind
sentence: The gale blew down hundreds of trees.
sentence_gap: The ____ blew down hundreds of trees.

explanation: literary; to run and jump in a happy way
sentence: Lambs were gambolling about in the spring sunshine.
sentence_gap: Lambs were __________ about in the spring sunshine.

explanation: to decorate food with a small amount of different food
sentence: Garnish the dish with parsley before serving.
sentence_gap: _______ the dish with parsley before serving.

explanation: to laugh repeatedly in a quiet but uncontrolled way, often at something silly or rude or when you are nervous
sentence: Stop that giggling in the back row!
sentence_gap: Stop that ________ in the back row!

explanation: impressive and large or important
sentence: His job has a grand title, but he's little more than a clerk.
sentence_gap: His job has a _____ title, but he's little more than a clerk.

explanation: a large, wooden musical instrument with many strings that you play with the fingers
sentence: He took off its cloth covering, and the harp gave out a jarring sound.
sentence_gap: He took off its cloth covering, and the ____ gave out a jarring sound.

explanation: a row of bushes or small trees planted close together, usually along the edge of a field, yard, or road
sentence: She kicked the ball so powerfully that it flew over the hedge.
sentence_gap: She kicked the ball so powerfully that it flew over the _____.

explanation: formal; (esp. of a crime) extremely bad or evil
sentence: In the enlightened 18th century popular fanaticism made of sacrilege the most heinous offence.
sentence_gap: In the enlightened 18th century popular fanaticism made of sacrilege the most _______ offence.

explanation: to walk in an awkward way, usually because the feet or legs are injured
sentence: Some of the runners could only manage to hobble over the finishing line.
sentence_gap: Some of the runners could only manage to ______ over the finishing line.

explanation: a large flying insect that can give a severe sting
sentence: It made Janet as mad as a hornet, but Martha's back in the classroom.
sentence_gap: It made Janet as mad as a ______, but Martha's back in the classroom.

explanation: having no excitement, interest, or new and different events
sentence: Most of the work is fairly humdrum.
sentence_gap: Most of the work is fairly _______.

explanation: the quality of not thinking that you are better than other people; the quality of being humble
sentence: He doesn't have the humility to admit when he's wrong.
sentence_gap: He doesn't have the ________ to admit when he's wrong.

explanation: formal; continuing without any possibility of being stopped
sentence: Aging is an inexorable process.
sentence_gap: Aging is an __________ process.

explanation: formal; an occasion when someone breaks a rule or law
sentence: Any attempt to influence the judges will be seen as an infraction of the rules.
sentence_gap: Any attempt to influence the judges will be seen as an __________ of the rules.

explanation: not showing emotions or thoughts and therefore very difficult to understand or get to know
sentence: He believes that a certain portion of life must remain inscrutable.
sentence_gap: He believes that a certain portion of life must remain ___________.

explanation: impossible to touch, to describe exactly, or to give an exact value
sentence: She has that intangible quality which you might call charisma.
sentence_gap: She has that __________ quality which you might call charisma.

explanation: formal; anger
sentence: The team drew the ire of local politicians when it moved to a new stadium outside the city.
sentence_gap: The team drew the ___ of local politicians when it moved to a new stadium outside the city.

explanation: informal; to move from side to side or up and down with quick short movements, or to make something do this
sentence: If the door won't open, try jiggling the key in the lock.
sentence_gap: If the door won't open, try ________ the key in the lock.

explanation: a bush or small tree with sweet-smelling purple or white flowers
sentence: The lilacs are in bloom.
sentence_gap: The ______ are in bloom.

explanation: formal; the middle of a group of people or things
sentence: Such beauty was unexpected in the midst of the city.
sentence_gap: Such beauty was unexpected in the _____ of the city.

explanation: noticeable in an unpleasant way
sentence: The logo was still visible but less obtrusive this time in beige.
sentence_gap: The logo was still visible but less _________ this time in beige.

explanation: specialized; to block something
sentence: Veins can get occluded by blood clots.
sentence_gap: Veins can get ________ by blood clots.

explanation: informal; likely to get angry and argue with people
sentence: He had been in an ornery mood all day, arguing with everyone who got in his way.
sentence_gap: He had been in an ______ mood all day, arguing with everyone who got in his way.

explanation: in a way that relates to how people, situations, or things seem to be, rather than how they are inside
sentence: The men led outwardly normal lives as fathers and husbands.
sentence_gap: The men led _________ normal lives as fathers and husbands.

explanation: a thick, dark cloud of smoke

sentence_gap: _____ of smoke obscured our view.

explanation: a large plate used for serving food or a meal with one type of food served on a large plate
sentence: I cut the apples into pieces and put them on a platter.

explanation: formal; an important job, especially one in government
sentence: She was offered a key post in the new government.She was offered a key post in the new government.

explanation: a bag or soft container for a small object or a small amount of something
sentence: All our electric shavers are supplied with a free travel pouch.

explanation: formal; to prevent something or make it impossible, or prevent someone from doing something
sentence: His contract precludes him from discussing his work with anyone outside the company.

explanation: a religious leader and teacher in the Jewish religion

explanation: a large pile of straw or hay that has been built in a regular shape
sentence: In summer months the siren can be heard almost daily as hay barns and hay ricks catch fire.
sentence_gap: In summer months the siren can be heard almost daily as hay barns and hay _____ catch fire.

explanation: approving; so interesting or exciting that it holds your attention completely
sentence: I found the film absolutely riveting.
sentence_gap: I found the film absolutely ________.

explanation: something that is not what it seems to be and is intended to deceive people, or someone who pretends to be something they are not
sentence: It turned out that he wasn't a real doctor at all - he was just a sham.

explanation: approving; a smooth shine or brightness

sentence_gap: The conditioner gives hair a beautiful soft _____.

explanation: to accept the responsibility for something
sentence: Teachers cannot be expected to shoulder all the blame for poor exam results.
sentence_gap: Teachers cannot be expected to ________ all the blame for poor exam results.

explanation: no longer new or fresh, usually as a result of being kept for too long
sentence: The morning after the party, their apartment smelled of stale cigarette smoke.
sentence_gap: The morning after the party, their apartment smelled of _____ cigarette smoke.

explanation: a type of food consisting usually of meat or fish and vegetables cooked slowly in a small amount of liquid
sentence: She prepared a hearty stew for dinner.
sentence_gap: She prepared a hearty ____ for dinner.

explanation: an area on the edge of a large town or city where people who work in the town or city often live

sentence_gap: We drove from middle-class _______ to a very poor inner-city area.

explanation: disapproving; behaving as if you are better than other people, and that their opinions, beliefs, or ideas are not important
sentence: He spoke in a haughty, supercilious voice.
sentence_gap: He spoke in a haughty, ____________ voice.

explanation: a pair of women's panties or men's underpants, or the bottom part of a bikini, that has only a very narrow strip of cloth, like a string, at the back

sentence_gap: I had on a hot pink halter top with a pink strapless bra and my really short black skirt with a pink _____.

explanation: literary; unable to move or stop looking at something because you are so interested, surprised, or frightened
sentence: Rabbits transfixed in the glare of car headlights are common victims on the roads. We all sat in silence, transfixed by what we saw on the screen.
sentence_gap: Rabbits __________ in the glare of car headlights are common victims on the roads. We all sat in silence, __________ by what we saw on the screen.

explanation: a long, narrow container without a lid that usually holds water or food for farm animals
sentence: Turning on the water, she filled their water trough before heading out for the longhorn shed, which was the closest to the trees.
sentence_gap: Turning on the water, she filled their water ______ before heading out for the longhorn shed, which was the closest to the trees.

explanation: money that you pay for being taught, especially at college or university
sentence: Few can afford the tuition of $12,000 a semester.
sentence_gap: Few can afford the _______ of $12,000 a semester.

explanation: done by one member of a group or an organization without the agreement of the other members
sentence: Opponents of the government have criticized the president's unilateral approach and believe broader international alliances are required.
sentence_gap: Opponents of the government have criticized the president's __________ approach and believe broader international alliances are required.

explanation: to explain something that is difficult to understand or is mysterious; to become clearer or easier to understand
sentence: The discovery will help scientists unravel the mystery of the Ice Age.
sentence_gap: The discovery will help scientists _______ the mystery of the Ice Age.

explanation: a great change, especially causing or involving much difficulty, activity, or trouble

sentence_gap: The ______ and orchard trees - apple, pear, plum and cherry - are cultivated everywhere.
